author: Special Correspondent
text:
The School of Law at SASTRA University has won the Christ Law School criminal trial advocacy national moot court competition held in Bengaluru on February 21.

The moot problem was on the Narcotic Drugs and Psychotrophic Substances Act. Around 24 teams from across the country took part in it.

SASTRA beat ILS Pune in the semi-finals before convincingly overcoming Amity University Law School in the finals, according to a SASTRA press release.

The team comprising Karthick Subramanian, Shriram, and G. Kartikeyan received the winner's trophy and cash award of Rs. 20,000 from Rama Jois, former Chief Justice of Punjab and Harayana High Court, the release added.
title: SASTRA School of Law wins moot court competition
